alert.note: Alert for Bayamon (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 06 at 3:49AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues and additional thunderstorms will heavy rains will be remain possible. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following , Bayamon, Catano, Guaynabo and San Juan. * WHEN...Until 700 AM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 349 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night and during the early morning hours when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
